result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather S. Teschler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample or show proof of prior submission and pay the DNA surcharge.  

Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 

If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Undergo an AODA assessment and follow all recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes:
Conditional jail term shall begin immediately.

The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

Consecutive to: To Taylor County Case 14CF57.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall undergo psychological treatment and follow through with any recommendations including taking any medications that are prescribed.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA and follow through with any treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Heather S. Teschler in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No factual inaccuracies to revocation packet per Attorney Nocco.  Statement by Attorney Tlusty regarding sentencing.  Statement by Attorney Nocco regarding sentencing.  Statement by Heather Teschler (Charnas).  Court finds defendant has 235 days sentence credit.  Court orders 1 year six months initial confinement followed by 2 years extended supervision.  Defendant is eligible for ERP and SAP; pay any unpaid court obligations;  maintain absolute sobriety; AODA follow through with treatment;  undergo a psychological treatment and follow through with any recommendations including taking any mediations that are prescribed.  - rt

records.addlTxt: Defendant Heather S. Teschler in court with attorney Robert A. Thorson.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement placed on the record by Ms. Tlusty.  DE entered a plea of no contest to Ct. 1.  Plea colloquy.  Court found plea given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently; accepted plea; found  DE guilty and ordered entry of JOC.  Pursuant to the agreement, remaining count is dismissed and read in.  Arguments by counsel.  Court withheld sentence and placed DE on probation for three years with the following conditions:  payment of court costs; DNA surcharge; 2 months in jail with Huber, consecutive to Taylor County Case No. 14CF57; AODA and follow through with recommended treatment; maintain absolute sobriety.  12 days sentence credit given.
Days Credit Worksheet

Defendant Heather S. Teschler in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Advised of right to counsel.  DE intends to contact SPD.  Further reading of complaint waived.  State recommended bond continued - so ordered.  Court advised DE of right to a timely preliminary hearing - waived.  PTC set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 2, 2014 at 09:30 am.
To Heather S. Teschler on March 12, 2014 at 12:40 p.m.

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $1000 cash bond with conditions of: Booking, and no possession or consumption of narcotics.  Response by DE. Court ordered bond with conditions as requested.  Initial appearance set for 04-08-2014 at 1:00 p.m.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure. Defendant shall not possess or consume narcotics.
